posts.title: Toyland Returns To Downtown Bentonville This Weekend
posts.content:
Kids are invited to check out the newest toys exclusive to Walmart at Toyland in Downtown Bentonville this Friday, Nov 4 from 11a-8p. 

  • Meet the heroes: Characters from Paw Patrol, Minions, and Cocomelon will be at the Square to interact with children and take photos, and guess who else will be there…? 
  • Full-on play day: Come enjoy demo tables, play areas, and race track sets; areas to test ride scooters and bikes; inflatables, photo booths, coloring walls, and free giveaways and raffles. 

Find more Toyland details HERE.

posts.title: Popable And Walmart Team Up To Empower Small Businesses
posts.content:
This week Popable and Walmart announced a partnership that will give small businesses the opportunity to rent retail space in Walmart stores across the country. 

  • It’s poppin’: Popable is a pop-up shop marketplace platform that connects brands and spaces for short-term retail leasing opportunities.
  • Symbiotic: The partnership will bring new brands and goods to local communities while benefiting small businesses with the growth potential of increased exposure. 

Read more about this strategic partnership HERE.

posts.title: Eureka Springs Hosts 75th Annual Ozark Folk Festival
posts.content:
The 75th Annual Ozark Folk Festival returns to Eureka Springs Nov 10-12 for three days of incredible regional and national folk music. 

  • Move your feet: The event will include free music and the folk fair each day from 10a-3p at The Auditorium followed by headliner performances for the historic Barefoot Ball in the basement of the Aud. 
  • Folk features: Enjoy amazing music all weekend long including headliners Hot Club of Cowtown, Pokey Lafarge, Shinyribs, Willi Carlisle, and Rachel Ammons.  

Find a schedule of the festival and purchase tickets HERE.

posts.title: Walton Arts Center Announces Winter Nights Event Series
posts.content:
Gather with family and friends to enjoy the lights, decor, and cups of cheer during Winter Nights at Walton Arts Center open every Thurs-Sat this December. 

  • Spread cheer: The Joy Pratt Markham Gallery will host games for children and adults, and guests can spread holiday cheer by writing a season greeting to a veteran or retirement home resident.
  • Winter wonderland: The Bradberry Amphitheater & Rose Garden will be open to the public with heaters and seating on a first-come-first-serve basis, and fire pits and snow dome seating can be reserved for groups.

Read more and make reservations HERE.

posts.title: Dickson Street’s Iconic Piano Bar Is Coming To Rogers
posts.content:
Arkansas’s original rock & roll dueling piano bar, The Piano Bar, is opening a new location in Rogers at the corner of Dixieland and Pleasant Crossing. 

  • Free listens: Dickson Street’s The Piano Bar showcases world-class musicians who know how to engage an audience with the best sing-along shows around. They stand apart from other piano bars because they never charge a cover to get in. 
  • Copy/paste/edit: Bringing all the great qualities of the original along with it, the Rogers location will also include a full menu grill, an outdoor patio, a larger selection of local brews and beers on draft, and plans to open earlier to offer a happy hour. 

Stay up to date with The Piano Bar & Grill HERE.

pick.title: NWA Daily Picks
pick.content:
• Ozark Beauty: Celebrate 50 years of the Buffalo National River with dinner and a screening of locally produced film "Undammed: A Buffalo River Adventure” in Downtown Rogers. Reserve tickets HERE.* 
  • Prettiest pumpkin: Fayetteville is hosting a Community Pumpkin Pageant tonight from 5-6:30p in the Lower Ramble. 
  • Chicken bucks: Tyson Foods is doing great work to increase financial literacy throughout America and recently joined efforts with the Financial Literacy for All movement.
  • Let's talk: Interested in advertising in the newsletter? Check out our deals HERE.

*Content is sponsored
